official_title: A joint resolution establishing the policy with respect to the number of digits which should be used as ZIP codes or other codes used for mail delivery.

summary.text: Prohibits the United States Postal Service from increasing the number of digits of the zip code until: (1) the Service and Congress have examined the costs, social consequences, and technical issues associated with zip code expansion and the alternative means of improving productivity in the sorting of mail; and (2) Congress has approved such an increase.
